common.welcome: Welcome to the Embassy of Kenya in Moscow
common.welcomeMessage: Welcome to the Embassy of the Republic of Kenya in Moscow. We are dedicated to serving and strengthening the diplomatic ties between Kenya and Russia.
common.workingHours: Working Hours: Monday to Friday, 9:00 AM - 5:00 PM
common.address: Address: 5 Lopukhinsky Lane, 119034 Moscow, Russian Federation

ambassador.name: H.E. Dr. Peter Mutuku Mathuki
ambassador.introduction: Dr. Peter Mutuku Mathuki is a distinguished diplomat and trade expert with over 25 years of experience in regional integration and private sector development.
ambassador.expertise: He brings extensive expertise in regional trade, customs, and private sector development, having worked across various sectors in East Africa and beyond.
ambassador.eac: Prior to his appointment, he served as the Secretary General of the East African Community (EAC), where he played a pivotal role in strengthening regional integration and trade relations.
ambassador.eabc: He previously held the position of Executive Director of the East African Business Council (EABC), where he championed private sector interests in the EAC integration process.
ambassador.eu: His experience includes working with various international organizations and serving as a key advisor on EU-EAC Economic Partnership Agreement negotiations.
ambassador.education: Dr. Mathuki holds a PhD in Strategic Management and Regional Integration from the University of Nairobi.

deputy.name: H.E. Mrs. Irene Achieng Oloo
deputy.introduction: Mrs. Irene Achieng Oloo is a career diplomat with extensive experience in international relations and diplomacy.
deputy.education: She holds a Master's degree in International Relations from the University of Nairobi and has completed various diplomatic training programs.
deputy.experience: With over 15 years in foreign service, she has served in various diplomatic missions and played key roles in strengthening bilateral relations.
deputy.peace: She has been instrumental in peace and security initiatives, particularly in regional cooperation and conflict resolution.
deputy.awards: Her distinguished service has been recognized with several awards for excellence in diplomacy and international relations.

consular.title: Consular Services
consular.description: Kenyan consular services provide essential support to Kenyan citizens living abroad and foreigners visiting Kenya. These services include:

visa.title: Electronic Travel Authorization (eTA) / Visa
visa.subtitle: Kenya eTA Information
visa.description: The Ministry of Interior and National Administration has developed an Electronic Travel Authorization (eTA) system for entry into the Republic of Kenya.
visa.details: The Kenya eTA is a semi-automated system that determines the eligibility of visitors to enter Kenya.
visa.applicationTime: eTA applications should be submitted at least 2 weeks prior to travel

passport.title: Passport Services
passport.applyOnEcitizen: Apply for this document on the ecitizen platform

newPassport.title: 1. New Passport
newPassport.forms: All applicants must complete three 19A application forms
requirements: Be a Kenyan citizen
Three duly filled passport application forms 19A
Birth certificate, adoption or registration certificate of the applicant (original and copy)
Second generation national ID (original and copy)
Three passport size colored photos (3.4 x 4.5 cm)
Certified copy of recommender's ID

childRequirements.title: If the applicant is a child, additional requirements include:
list: Two photocopies of pages of parent(s) current Kenyan passport
Two copies of parents' national ID cards
Two copies of child's international and/or Kenyan birth certificate
Two copies of parents' birth certificates
Completed parents' consent form (obtained at the Embassy)

replacement.title: 2. Replacement of Passport after 5/10 years (expired / filled)
requirements: Three duly filled passport application forms 19A
Cover letter addressed to the Ambassador
Copy of bio-data page of current passport
Three passport size colored photos
Certified copy of recommender's ID
Copy of birth certificate or national ID
Original passport to be replaced

mutilated.title: 3. Replacement of Mutilated Passport
requirements: Three duly filled passport application forms 19A
Mutilated passport to be replaced
Copy of bio-data page of current passport
Affidavit describing circumstances under which mutilation occurred

Three passport size colored photos (3.4 x 4.5 cm) of the applicant, one of which must be certified by the recommender as a true likeness of the applicant. The applicant's ears must be visible in the photo.
Certified copy of recommender's ID
Application form for replacement of mutilated passport (obtained at the Embassy)

lost.title: 4. Replacement of Lost Passport
requirements: Original birth certificate
Copy of birth certificate (both sides) used to issue the lost passport
Three duly filled passport application forms 19A

Three passport size colored photos (3.4 x 4.5 cm) of the applicant, one of which must be certified by the recommender as a true likeness of the applicant. The applicant's ears must be visible in the photo.
Affidavit describing circumstances of loss
Original police abstract (in Russian) and English translation indicating when and where the loss was reported
Certified copy of recommender's ID
Cover letter addressed to the Ambassador explaining circumstances of loss from the applicant
Application form for replacement of lost passport (obtained at the Embassy)

diplomatic.title: 5. Diplomatic Passport
requirements: Three duly filled passport application forms 19A
Letter confirming that the person meets the criteria set out in the Third Schedule to the Kenya Citizenship and Immigration Regulations, 2012, Legal Notice No. 64.
Old passport or original birth certificate and national ID together with their respective photocopies
Certified copy of recommender's ID
Three passport size colored photos of the applicant, one of which must be certified by the recommender as a true likeness of the applicant.

emergency.title: 6. Emergency Travel Document
requirements: One-time emergency travel document issued at the Embassy free of charge for repatriation to Kenya
Requirements include: Interview at the Embassy; must be scheduled not later than three days before confirmed flight date.
Two (2) passport size photos
Proof of Kenyan citizenship i.e. Kenyan passport or national ID.
Police abstract in case of lost passport.
Confirmed booking/flight ticket

regainCitizenship.title: APPLICATION TO REGAIN CITIZENSHIP
regainCitizenship.intro: To apply to regain Kenyan citizenship for those who may have lost it through renunciation or acquisition of citizenship of another country, the following are required:
requirements: Proof of Kenyan citizenship (birth certificate, passport or national ID)
Proof of citizenship of another country (notarized passport).
Two passport size photos
Completed Form 5 application to regain citizenship

notes.title: Notes:
list: Copy of applicant's national ID is MANDATORY for every application
These requirements are not exhaustive, additional information may be required if necessary

goodConduct.title: Certificate of Good Conduct
goodConduct.applyOnEcitizen: Apply for this document on the ecitizen platform

requirements.title: POLICE CLEARANCE CERTIFICATE REQUIREMENTS
list: An Introductory letter by the applicant
Original second-generation national identification card and a clear photocopy (Kenyan passports not accepted).
Pay USD 20 as a processing fee

Fingerprints and palm prints recorded on a prescribed form at the nearest Police Station in Russia. This document should have a police endorsement seal or stamp and a translation of the same into English.

If not registered and issued with a Kenyan ID Card as per Cap. 107 Laws of Kenya, must prove that he/she attained the age of 18 years while outside the country and is yet to return. A letter from the mission, certified copy of birth certificate, and passport are relevant in this case.
If the applicant is a foreigner, in addition to the above requirements, documentary proof of residence in Kenya and a certified copy of the applicant's passport will also be required.

marriage.title: Marriage Certificate
marriage.applyOnEcitizen: Apply for this document on the ecitizen platform

noImpediment.title: CERTIFICATE OF NO IMPEDIMENT TO MARRIAGE
noImpediment.description: Every Kenyan wishing to marry abroad has to apply for a Certificate of No Impediment to Marriage from the nearest Kenyan Mission. Marriages conducted without issuance of this Certificate will neither be recognized by the Mission nor the Authorities in Kenya.
noImpediment.processingTime: Issuance of this certificate involves a search by the Registrar of Marriages to establish the civil status of the applicant. For this reason, it takes time, and it is therefore advisable to apply well before the planned date of marriage, preferably 3 months in advance.
noImpediment.statusNote: Note: Do not indicate your marital status on the application form as Single. Enter either Spinster, Bachelor, Widowed, or Divorced.
noImpediment.sameGenderNote: The Kenya Government neither acknowledges nor endorses same-sex marriages. Please note that Certification can only be done at the Embassy in which case the applicant comes with the original and a copy or before a notary public. The Mission does not accept scanned certified copies or photocopies of certified copies.

requirements.title: The applicant requires the following:
list: A completed application form for certificate of no impediment
Certified copy of your passport
Certified copy of your birth certificate
Certified copy of your fiancée's passport
Fee of USD 70

birth.title: Application for Birth Certificate
birth.applyOnEcitizen: Apply for this document on the ecitizen platform

kenyansAbroad.title: APPLICATION FOR KENYAN BIRTH CERTIFICATE FOR KENYANS BORN ABROAD
kenyansAbroad.description: The following documents are required for processing Birth Certificates for Kenyans born abroad:
requirements: Two (2) application forms (BDA1) duly filled and signed
Copy of father's passport (translated into English if it's not in English) duly certified by the Embassy
Copy of mother's passport (translated into English if it's not in English)
Notification of birth/birth certificate issued by the civil authorities or the hospital (translated, certified by relevant Government agency)
Two copies of marriage certificate translated into English or international marriage certificate (if legally married)
Processing fee USD 5

contact.title: FURTHER DETAILS MAY BE OBTAINED FROM:

pets.title: Requirements to Import Cats/Dogs as Pets

preArrival.title: Document to be obtained at Embassy Prior to Departure:
preArrival.description: In accordance with the Animal Disease Act, visitors to Kenya are required to obtain an import permit for their cat or dog before they can bring the animal into the country.
preArrival.permitDetails: This permit can be obtained at the Embassy, upon presentation of a valid vaccination booklet (check with veterinarian) and payment of USD 50 per animal. The permit is valid for thirty (30) days from the date of issue and is only valid for one consignment. The Import permit must accompany the animal during importation.

otherDocuments.title: OTHER DOCUMENTS REQUIRED:
list: Veterinary certificate signed no more than five days prior to departure, stating that the animal is free of infectious diseases.

Valid rabies certificate. If the animal was vaccinated less than 6 months before departure, also a certificate from a government veterinary officer of the country of origin, stating that no rabies cases have occurred within 50 km of the animal's place of origin within the preceding 6 months.
Certificate from the captain of the plane/ship carrying the animal, stating that the animal has not left the craft between embarkation and arrival, and was isolated from all other cats/dogs.
Animals in transit for less than 48 hours do not need these certificates but will be kept in isolation at the owner's expense and can only leave Kenya by air or sea.
Cats/dogs entering Kenya by land must be reported within three days of arrival.

moreInfo.title: MORE INFORMATION:
moreInfo.description: More information about importation of animals into Kenya can be obtained from the following:

ministry.text: Ministry of Livestock Development (Veterinary Services & Disease Control)

kenyaNationals.title: KENYA NATIONALS
requirements: Original document and copy (copy to be retained at the Embassy). If it is a copy of the original to be certified, then the applicant should bring two copies and the original document.
Academic certificates (Degrees, Diplomas, KCSE certificates, etc.) will be authenticated at no charge at the Embassy.
All other documents will be authenticated at USD 20 per document. Please avail the exact amount in cash.
kenyaNationals.note: Kindly note that only Kenyan documents certified by the Ministry of Foreign Affairs and International Trade, Kenya, can be certified or legalized at the Embassy of Kenya Moscow.

foreignNationals.title: FOREIGN NATIONALS
requirements: Original document duly authenticated by the Ministry of Foreign Affairs of the Applicant. The document should bear proof of certification (seal and signature).
A fee of USD 20 per document payable in cash. Please avail the exact amount in cash.

originalDegree.title: Legalization of Original Degree Certificates
originalDegree.subtitle: Required for use of documents in Kenya

steps.title: Original documents submitted through university to MFA, RF (consular legalization department):
steps.contacts: Contacts: Moscow, 1 Neopalimovskyi pereulok, 12 (Smolenskaya / Park Kultury metro stations)

steps.title: Original documents stamped at Kenya Embassy, Moscow:
steps.fee: Fee: free of charge for Kenyan citizens. For other nationalities, USD 20 per document

notarizedCopies.title: Legalization of Notarized & Translated Copies of Degree Certificates

steps.title: Submitted through Multifunctional Center for provision of public services in Moscow (MFC/ МФЦ) to MFA, RF (consular legalization department):
steps.contacts: Contacts: Moscow, Ryzanskiy Prospect, 2 building 3 (shopping mall Gorod), Nizhegorodskaya metro station

steps.title: Stamped at Kenya Embassy, Moscow:
steps.fee: Fee: free of charge for Kenyan citizens; Time of certification: 1 day

apostille.title: Apostille
apostille.description: An apostille is a form of authentication issued to documents for use in countries that participate in the Hague Convention of 1961.
requirements: Original document
Copy of the document
Valid identification document

address.title: Where to Get Apostille
address.text: Apostilles can be obtained from the Ministry of Foreign Affairs in the country where the document was issued.

nairobi.title: Getting Around Nairobi
nairobi.lightRailDesc: The Nairobi Light Rail is a super convenient way to zip around the city! With its modern vibe and comfy ride, it links key areas in the city making it perfect for avoiding traffic. Just hop on, and you'll be zooming past those busy streets in no time!
nairobi.matatuDesc: If you want the true Kenyan experience, you HAVE to hop on a matatu! It is the heartbeat of the city's public transport. They're always full with awesome music, and you can find routes all over Nairobi. Just remember to bring your best mood, take care of your personal belongings, and stay part of the adventure!

kenya.title: Getting Around Kenya
kenya.highwaysDesc: Kenya's highways offer smooth travel between major destinations. The Nairobi-Mombasa Highway (A109) connects the capital to the coast, while the Nairobi-Nakuru-Eldoret Highway (A104) passes through the stunning Great Rift Valley. For scenic drives, the Mai Mahiu-Narok Road offers breathtaking valley views, while the Mombasa-Malindi Road showcases Kenya's coastline. Routes to Mount Kenya, Amboseli, and Maasai Mara provide stunning landscapes and wildlife sightings.
kenya.airportsDesc: Traveling by air? Kenya has a great mix of local and international airports. Jomo Kenyatta International Airport (JKIA) in Nairobi is your main hub for international flights, while places like Wilson Airport cater to domestic flights. Super handy for reaching places like Maasai Mara or Lake Nakuru quickly!
kenya.railwayDesc: For a chill ride across the country, check out the intercity trains! The Madaraka Express connects Nairobi to Mombasa in a snap. With comfy seats and beautiful views, it's a fab way to travel and experience the scenic beauty of Kenya.

culture.title: Cultural Heritage of Kenya
culture.description: Kenya is a multiethnic and multiracial society rich in cultural and natural heritage. Our diverse traditions, customs, and wildlife make Kenya a unique destination for cultural exploration.
culture.festivalsDesc: Experience the vibrant cultural festivals of Kenya, from the Lamu Cultural Festival showcasing Swahili culture to the Lake Turkana Cultural Festival celebrating the traditions of northern Kenya's communities. These festivals feature traditional dances, music, crafts, and ceremonies that bring Kenya's rich cultural heritage to life.
culture.museumsDesc: The National Museums of Kenya preserve and showcase our country's rich cultural and natural heritage. Visit the Nairobi National Museum to explore Kenya's cultural evolution, or discover prehistoric findings at the Kariandusi Museum. Each museum offers unique insights into Kenya's history and culture.
culture.wildlifeDesc: Kenya Wildlife Services protects and manages our country's incredible wildlife heritage. From the majestic elephants of Amboseli to the flamingos of Lake Nakuru, our national parks and reserves offer unforgettable encounters with Africa's most iconic wildlife species.

tourism.title: Tourism in Kenya
tourism.description: Welcome to Kenya, a land of breathtaking landscapes and rich cultural heritage. From pristine beaches to majestic wildlife, Kenya offers unforgettable experiences for every traveler.
tourism.safarisDesc: Experience the thrill of African wildlife safaris in Kenya's world-renowned national parks and reserves. Watch the Great Migration in Masai Mara, spot the 'Big Five' in Amboseli against the backdrop of Mount Kilimanjaro, or explore the unique desert landscapes of Samburu. Our safaris offer unparalleled wildlife viewing opportunities in their natural habitat.
tourism.cuisineDesc: Discover Kenya's rich culinary heritage, from traditional Swahili dishes along the coast to hearty upcountry fare. Sample local delicacies like nyama choma (grilled meat), sukuma wiki (collard greens), and fresh tropical fruits. Our diverse cuisine reflects the multicultural tapestry of Kenyan society.
tourism.experiencesDesc: Immerse yourself in authentic Kenyan cultural experiences. Visit traditional Maasai villages, participate in local ceremonies, or explore the historic streets of Lamu Old Town, a UNESCO World Heritage site. Each region offers unique insights into Kenya's rich cultural traditions and warm hospitality.

magicalKenya.description: Kenya is a land of diverse landscapes, rich culture, and endless possibilities. From the bustling city of Nairobi to the stunning beaches of the coast, there is something for everyone to explore.

foreignAffairs.ministry: Ministry of Foreign and Diaspora Affairs
foreignAffairs.description: The Ministry of Foreign Affairs of Kenya plays a crucial role in managing Kenya's international relations and promoting the country's interests abroad.
foreignAffairs.engagement: The Ministry actively engages in diplomatic efforts to enhance cooperation with other nations, focusing on areas such as trade, security, and cultural exchange.

scholarship.title: Scholarship Opportunities.
scholarship.description: The government offers scholarships for Kenyan students to study abroad, fostering educational ties with other countries.

cultural.title: Cultural Exchange Programs.
cultural.description: The Ministry promotes cultural exchanges to enhance mutual understanding and respect among nations.

cooperation.title: International Cooperation.
cooperation.description: Engaging in partnerships with various countries to address global challenges such as climate change and security.

foreignAffairs.services: The Ministry also provides essential services to Kenyans living abroad and facilitates their engagement with the Kenyan government.
foreignAffairs.visitLink: Visit the Ministry of Foreign Affairs

sports.title: Sports in Kenya
sports.description: Sports in Kenya is deeply rooted in culture and history, with a rich tradition of indigenous sports and strong influence from British colonialism. Kenya has emerged as a powerhouse in various sports, particularly in athletics.
sports.athletics: Kenya has gained worldwide recognition for its dominance in middle and long-distance running. In recent years, Kenyan athletes have particularly excelled in marathons, with Eliud Kipchoge being a standout figure, famous for breaking the world marathon record.

achievements.title: Recent Achievements.
achievements.description: Kipchoge's recent performance at the Berlin Marathon showcased his incredible talent and determination, further cementing Kenya's reputation in athletics.

rugby.title: Rugby Success.
rugby.description: Kenya's Rugby Sevens team has achieved significant success on the international stage, actively competing in tournaments such as the World Rugby Sevens Series.

diverse.title: Sports Diversity.
diverse.description: Beyond athletics, Kenya has a vibrant sports culture that includes rugby, cricket, football, and volleyball.

sports.conclusion: Kenya's rich sporting heritage continues to inspire future generations of athletes to strive for excellence both locally and internationally.

nairobi.title: The Heart of Kenya
nairobi.description: Nairobi is a vibrant city that serves as the political, economic, and cultural hub of Kenya. Known for its rich history and diverse culture, Nairobi is home to various attractions that reflect the country's heritage and modernity.
nairobi.wildlife: Nairobi is not only known for its skyscrapers but also for its rich cultural heritage and wildlife. The city is home to the Nairobi National Park, where visitors can see lions, giraffes, and rhinos just a short drive from the city center.

culture.title: Cultural Diversity.
culture.description: Nairobi hosts numerous cultural festivals and events that celebrate its diverse communities.

history.title: Historical Sites.
history.description: The city features important historical landmarks such as the Kenyatta International Conference Centre (KICC) and the National Museum of Kenya.

conservation.title: Wildlife Conservation.
conservation.description: The Nairobi National Park is a unique wildlife reserve that offers a glimpse of Africa's wildlife amidst urban development.

nairobi.conclusion: The Government of Kenya has made significant efforts to promote tourism in Nairobi by enhancing infrastructure and preserving cultural heritage sites. This makes Nairobi not just a gateway to Kenya but also a destination in its own right.

trade.title: Trade and Investment in Kenya
trade.description: Kenya is strategically positioned as a gateway to East Africa, offering numerous trade and investment opportunities across various sectors.
trade.initiatives: The Kenyan government actively promotes trade and investment through various initiatives, including the Lamu Port South Sudan Ethiopia Transport Corridor (LAPSSET), which aims to enhance connectivity and facilitate trade across the region.

investment.title: Investment Opportunities.
investment.description: Kenya offers numerous incentives for foreign investors, including tax holidays and exemptions in various sectors.

agreements.title: Trade Agreements.
agreements.description: Kenya is a member of several regional trade agreements that facilitate access to markets within East Africa and beyond.

policies.title: Supportive Government Policies.
policies.description: The government is committed to creating a conducive environment for business through regulatory reforms and infrastructure development.

exports.title: Key Exports.
exports.description: Major exports include tea, coffee, horticultural products, and pyrethrum, contributing significantly to the economy.

agriculture.title: Agriculture in Kenya
agriculture.description: Agriculture is the backbone of Kenya's economy, contributing significantly to the country's GDP and providing employment to millions of Kenyans. The sector is diverse, ranging from small-scale farming to large commercial operations.
agriculture.cooperation: The Ministry of Agriculture works closely with farmers, providing support through various programs and initiatives aimed at increasing agricultural productivity and ensuring food security.

productivity.title: Improving Productivity.
productivity.description: Through modern farming techniques, improved seeds, and better irrigation systems, Kenya is working to enhance agricultural productivity across all regions.

market.title: Market Access.
market.description: The government is implementing strategies to improve market access for farmers, including development of storage facilities and transport infrastructure.

knowledge.title: Knowledge Transfer.
knowledge.description: Agricultural extension services provide farmers with crucial information about modern farming methods, pest control, and climate-smart agriculture.

investment.title: Investment Opportunities.
investment.description: The agricultural sector offers numerous investment opportunities in areas such as agro-processing, storage facilities, and agricultural technology.

agriculture.conclusion: Kenya's agricultural sector continues to evolve, embracing modern technology and sustainable practices to meet the growing demands of both local and international markets.

education.title: Education in Kenya
education.description: Kenya's education system is one of the most developed in East Africa, offering quality education from primary to tertiary levels. The system emphasizes both academic excellence and practical skills development.
education.curriculum: The Competency Based Curriculum (CBC) is Kenya's current education system, designed to develop learners' skills, knowledge, and competencies for the 21st century.

cbcRating.title: CBC Assessment.
cbcRating.description: The new curriculum emphasizes continuous assessment rather than just final examinations, allowing for a more comprehensive evaluation of learner abilities.

cbcEmphasis.title: Skills Development.
cbcEmphasis.description: Focus on developing practical skills, critical thinking, and problem-solving abilities alongside traditional academic subjects.

tvet.title: Technical Education.
tvet.description: Strong emphasis on Technical and Vocational Education and Training (TVET) to provide practical skills needed in the job market.

institutions.title: Educational Institutions.
institutions.description: Kenya has numerous public and private universities, technical colleges, and vocational training centers across the country.

financing.title: Education Financing.
financing.description: Various government initiatives and programs exist to support education financing, including scholarships and student loans.

links.wiki: Learn More About Education in Kenya

visionSection.title: Vision
visionSection.description: To be a modern diplomatic mission committed to efficient and effective diplomatic representation.

missionSection.title: Mission
missionSection.description: To provide quality diplomatic representation and to embody the aspirations of the Kenyan people and international community through diplomatic contacts, integration, transmission, and utilization of diplomatic knowledge for the development and prosperity of Kenyan people in particular and mankind in general.

valuesSection.title: Core Values
valuesSection.description: Patriotism, teamwork, collective responsibility, professionalism, discipline, dignity, integrity, and equity.

contact.title: Contact Us

diaspora.title: Kenyans in Diaspora Registration
diaspora.description: Registration for Kenyan citizens residing in the Russian Federation.
